DataElement.preferredName: Pulmonary Diffusion Capacity Assessment Not Performed Reason
DataElement.preferredDefinition: The free-text field used to described the reason the diffusion capacity test was not performed.

DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: Having to do with the lungs._The movement of chemical species under the influence of a concentration difference and as a result of random thermal agitation. The species will move from the high concentration area to the low concentration area till the concentration is uniform in the whole phase._The amount that can be contained.  It can refer to the volume that can be held, such as lung capacity, or the number of people that can be contained in a room or building._The final result of a determination of the value, significance, or extent of.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: Having to do with the lungs.:The movement of chemical species under the influence of a concentration difference and as a result of random thermal agitation. The species will move from the high concentration area to the low concentration area till the concentration is uniform in the whole phase.

Concepts.definition: Relating to the lungs as the intended site of administration, where the pharmaceutical product is administered, usually by inhalation, for local action in the lower respiratory tract or for systemic action after absorption via the lower respiratory tract.

The movement of chemical species under the influence of a concentration difference and as a result of random thermal agitation. The species will move from the high concentration area to the low concentration area till the concentration is uniform in the whole phase.

Property.preferredDefinition: The amount that can be contained.  It can refer to the volume that can be held, such as lung capacity, or the number of people that can be contained in a room or building.:The final result of a determination of the value, significance, or extent of.
